CatDescriptText: Blanche Miller, housewife, Fifth Ward and Deanna Marsh, high school senior, East McKeesport, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 21, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that racket squads eliminate vice and crime?" Mrs. Miller's answer reads: "I don't know about the local squads, but most racket squad do help to eliminate and reduce crime and vice."  Ms. Marsh's answer reads: " I believe they do."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Blanche Miller wearing dark sleeveless waffle patterned dress, standing on Liberty Avenue with Gateway Center in background; Portrait of Deanna Marsh wearing light colored button down collared dress, gloves, and hat, standing on Liberty Avenue with Gateway Center in background, Downtown
